comment.author: 21734563@N04
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Veterans of the American Civil War, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 31439438@N05
comment._content: The 44th Indiana Volunteer Infantry was organized at Fort Wayne, Indiana and mustered into service on November 22, 1861. They fought in many of the major battles in the Western Theater that included Fort Donelson, Shiloh, Corinth, and Stone's River in 1862, and Chickamauga and Chattanooga  in 1863. Afterwards, they were assigned to Provost duty around Chattanooga, Tenn. and held this status for the remainder of  the war until finally being mustered out on September 14, 1865. The regiment lost 4 Officers and 76 enlisted men killed and mortally wounded, and another 9 officers and 220 enlisted men died from disease for a total of 309.
